title: Topic 003 Question 054
body: You are developing an app to store globally distributed data in several Azure Blob Storage containers. Each container hosts multiple blobs where each instance of the app will store the data. You enable versioning and soft delete for the blobs.
App testing and incorrect code have frequently corrupted data. Development of the app must allow data to be restored to a previous day for testing.
You need to configure the storage account to support point-in-time restore.
options: Enable the change feed on the storage account to begin capturing and recording changes.
Configure object replication and specify replication rules.
Create a snapshot of the blob in the hot tier.
Configure an immutability policy that is scoped to a blob version.
